theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on replicative senescence of immune cells, thymic involution, and chronic immune activation driving immune decline and inflammation.
Centers on persistent low-level systemic inflammation as a driver of aging and disease, emphasizing inflammatory imbalance and immune maladaptation.
Describes age-related chronic inflammation with genetic and endocrine modulators contributing to tissue loss and immune decline.
Integrates immunosenescence and inflammaging as interconnected processes driving immune dysfunction and systemic inflammation.
Links immunosenescence with oxi-inflamm-aging, highlighting sex hormone modulation and immune-driven systemic aging.
Focuses on thymic involution, naive lymphocyte decline, and oligoclonal expansions contributing to adaptive immune deficits.
Describes immune senescence and chronic inflammation as drivers of accelerated aging in HIV infection.
Emphasizes cellular senescence, SASP, trained innate immunity, and their roles in immunosenescence and inflammaging.
Details immunosenescence and inflammaging with chronic antigenic load and genetic regulation influencing longevity.
Focuses on genomic remodeling, senescent cells, and chronic inflammation driving immune aging.
Highlights immune remodeling driven by chronic antigenic stimulation from persistent viral infections like CMV.
Focuses on thymic involution and persistent viral infections causing T cell exhaustion and immune remodeling.
Centers on thymic involution as the primary driver of immune aging and decline in T cell function.
Describes interplay of immunosenescence and inflammaging as central to systemic aging and age-related diseases.
Emphasizes thymic involution, naive T cell reduction, and T cell exhaustion as key mechanisms of immune aging.
Focuses on elevated proinflammatory cytokines and dysregulated cytokine production driving chronic inflammation in aging.
Highlights chronic antigenic stress from persistent infections and inflammaging as drivers of immune aging.
Describes broad immune system deterioration with age linking immune decline to systemic aging and morbidity.
Integrates immune cell senescence, mitochondrial dysfunction, and chronic inflammation as drivers of systemic aging.
Links immune senescence, thymic involution, and inflammaging to autoimmunity and aging processes.
Focuses on immunosenescence and inflammaging with premature immune aging in rheumatoid arthritis as a model.
Emphasizes thymic involution, inflammaging, and their impact on neurodegeneration and systemic aging.
Describes senescent immune cell accumulation impairing innate and adaptive immunity and promoting inflammaging.
Details decline in immune barriers, inflammaging, and adaptive immune dysfunction contributing to age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Immune Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic control of immune system genes influencing lifespan and disease susceptibility.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Mediator Imbalance in Inflammaging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes imbalance of pro- and anti-inflammatory lipid mediators from arachidonic acid metabolism driving chronic inflammation.
Focuses on NLRP3 inflammasome activation by metabolic and mitochondrial dysfunction as a central driver of inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammatory Host Response Life History Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains evolutionary trade-offs mediated by inflammatory host response shaping aging and fertility strategies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Modulation of Inflammation via TLR4 Polymorphisms Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on TLR4 genetic variants modulating inflammatory responses and influencing aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation and Immune Gene Expression Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes altered immune gene expression and reduced inflammatory mediator synthesis contributing to delayed aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immunosenescence as a Causal Driver of Mortality Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links immune decline against pathogens to increased mortality risk and organismal aging in natural populations.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Dysfunction as a Driver of Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes early immune dysfunction, genetically and environmentally modulated, as a causal driver of systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autoantibody Accumulation and Immune-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on somatic hypermutation and autoantibody accumulation driving chronic inflammation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Unresolved Inflammation and Immune Balance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes loss of balance between pro- and anti-inflammatory immune arms causing unresolved inflammation and aging diseases.
